result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prior: 749 Michaelis Street, Marinette, WI 54143

Cash bond conditions modified:
Removed the Soberlink requirement

3:21 PM Defendant Patrick D. Walk in court.  Attorney Todd G. Simon in court for Patrick D. Walk.  Attorney Kathryn Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court heard on off record discussions.
ADA heard on statues for OWI - does not include electric bicycles.
ADA heard and moves to dismiss Count 1 and 2.
Atty Simon agrees.
Court heard and grants the motion.
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 2 with prejudice.
Atty Simon heard and requests another hearing in about 30 days.
Court schedules with parties.
Atty Simon heard on modification of bond.
Requests Soberlink be removed from bond condition.
ADA agrees.
Court heard and removes the Soberlink requirement from bond, effective immediately.
3:27 PM
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss

3:09 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick D. Walk in court.  Attorney Todd G. Simon appeared by ZOOM for Patrick D. Walk. 
Atty Simon - waiver, already efiled, satisfied.
Court reviews form w/Deft.
Deft waives prelim.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim and binds over for trial.
Court moves forward to arraignment.
DA heard - information will be filed and will track complaint.
Atty Simon - enters n/g pleas.
Court schedules STC.
3:15 pm
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:10 pm.

9:08 AM Prosecuting attorney robert James mraz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick D. Walk in court.  Attorney Todd G. Simon appeared by Zoom video for Patrick D. Walk. 
Court calls case. 
Atty spks- has reviewed copy of complaint with deft.
Deft aware of maximum charges and penalties. 
Waivers formal reading.
Requests Prelim.
Court schedules with parties. 
9:10 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter to Judge requesting to reschedule hearing

Order for Defendant to Abstain From Alcohol and For Testing

10:19 AM Defendant Patrick D. Walk appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
Deft heard.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $2,500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx, not to be on the premises of any bars or taverns whose primary business is the sale of alcohol, no operating a motor vehicle including an electric bicycle without a valid license, Compliance with Soberlink, no contact with A.B.
Court schedules with parties.
10:26 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
